Package pieces

Class Piece

  • java.lang.Object
    • pieces.Piece
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Bishop, King, Knight, Pawn, Queen, Rook
    public abstract class Piece
extends java.lang.Object
    Piece is an abstract class to represent a chess piece object. Contains functions that every piece contains.
    Author:
    Vincent Phung, William McFarland

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private java.lang.String color
      Color of the current piece.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Piece​(java.lang.String color)
      Constructor that initializes a piece object.

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      abstract java.util.ArrayList<Square> getAtkPath​(Square[][] board, Square cur, Square dest)
      Creates and returns a list that contains the squares that form a path from the current square to the destination square based on the type of piece on the current square.
      java.lang.String getColor()
      Gets the color of the current piece.
      abstract boolean pathBlocked​(Square[][] board, Square cur, Square dest)
      Determines whether the piece on the current square can reach the destination square without any pieces in between its path.
      boolean sameColor​(Piece dest)
      Checks if another piece is the same color as the current piece.
      abstract boolean validMove​(Board boardObj, Square cur, Square dest)
      Determines whether the current type of piece can move from cur to dest based on the chess rules for each piece.

    • Method Detail

      • getColor

        public java.lang.String getColor()
        Gets the color of the current piece.
        Returns:
        Color of the current piece.

      • sameColor

        public boolean sameColor​(Piece dest)
        Checks if another piece is the same color as the current piece.
        Parameters:
        dest - Other piece object to be compared to.
        Returns:
        True if both pieces are the same color.

      • pathBlocked

        public abstract boolean pathBlocked​(Square[][] board,
                                    Square cur,
                                    Square dest)
        Determines whether the piece on the current square can reach the destination square without any pieces in between its path.
        Parameters:
        board - Contains the state of all of the squares/pieces on the board.
        cur - The currently selected square.
        dest - The destination square that the user wants to move to.
        Returns:
        True if there are no pieces in between the path of cur and dest.

      • validMove

        public abstract boolean validMove​(Board boardObj,
                                  Square cur,
                                  Square dest)
        Determines whether the current type of piece can move from cur to dest based on the chess rules for each piece.
        Parameters:
        boardObj - An instance of the board class.
        cur - The currently selected square.
        dest - The destination square that the user wants to move to.
        Returns:
        True if the piece on the current square can successfully move to the dest square.

      • getAtkPath

        public abstract java.util.ArrayList<Square> getAtkPath​(Square[][] board,
                                                       Square cur,
                                                       Square dest)
        Creates and returns a list that contains the squares that form a path from the current square to the destination square based on the type of piece on the current square. Path does not include cur or dest squares only the squares in between the two.
        Parameters:
        board - Contains the state of all of the squares/pieces on the board.
        cur - The currently selected square.
        dest - The destination square that the user wants to move to.
        Returns:
        A list of squares that form a path from cur to dest.
